result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry G Lindorff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terry G Lindorff is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terry G Lindorff was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must provide a DNA sample and pay a $250.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court's Office - Bond to be applied.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

May not vote or hold public office until civil rights are restored.  
Not to have contact with:  Tommy Hannah or Nicole Stewart.  
Absolute Sobriety.  Subject to testing to determine compliance upon reasonable suspicion.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.
Bond to be applied to any other amounts due and owing before refunding to poster.
$290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office - Bond to be applied.

timeConds.notes:
30 days to be served upfront beginning 2/6/16, by 4:00 p.m.
150 days banked/stayed for use by Probation if necessary.
5 days sentence credit if revoked.
Defendant may serve sentence in Barron County if at no cost to Polk County.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry G Lindorff
